title: "Vampirism is a tier 3 utility mastery with 3 ranks."
body:
Vampirism is a tier 3 utility mastery with 3 ranks. 
ok how it is supposed to be usefull ,? Requires 8 points in Utility
maybe can be used on  {{champion:69}} or {{champion:84}} , but its not worth the 8 point when u can get better stats in defense or offense .
rework ?

edit : take tankyness and hp regen in defense is more worth , need maths

replies.body:
Something about the utility being less focused strictly on combat stats does make it feel as though you're leaving something on the table whenever you go deep into it as anything but a support (there are probably some other exceptions as well). For Vampirism specifically, it does feel odd that its best synergies are with high offense builds, but heavy offense masteries block you from getting the full benefit of this mastery.

It is, however, possible that 3% Lifesteal/Spellvamp would just be broken in any position that let you get it with offense masteries. I wouldn't go so far as to say we should be reworking the mastery into something else entirely, because I honestly don't know if it is regularly used to success.

How many of you guys and gals find themselves taking Vampirism and feeling good about it? On which champions? And does your final mastery split usually send you to at least 21 points in Utility? Or just far enough to get these?

As a mid-main and a high silver noob, I personally like going 15/0/15. The  combined sustain between vampirism and meditation make it much easier to win lane by pure attrition, and I have not really felt a loss of damage from not going 21 into the offensive tree.
---
As a side note, it is fun to go Morgana mid with spellvamp runes, and vampirism so you walk into lane with 19% spell vamp (add Hextech Gunblade in to have 49% speelvamp by level 13 ;p)
14/0/14 leaves you with 2 mastery points left? are you sure you're silver and not pre-level 30?
Woops, that's a typo there, sorry. I meant 15/0/15. I edited the original post.
I mean... Hextech Gunblade Morg XD
By no means for tryharding, just a fun gimmick due to it's sheer stupidity. XD
There is no cap at spell vamp... it is just a really hard to get stat which usually don't even help all that much
CDR caps at 40%, not spellvamp.

When i first started playing the game I would put a point in vampirism to help me with sustain, because I love being able to stay in my lane longer. The fact is once I removed a point from this mastery and put it to the buff duration, I didn't even notice a difference in my sustain at all. If you want better sustain/healing your better off taking biscuits, plus you get some mana from them.

I've tried it alongside vampirism quints on {{champion:8}} and {{champion:85}} quite a bit. Who better to utilize it than champions not gated by mana... right?!

It being percentage based means the effect it has early game is hardly noticeable at all.

By late game you might notice it a little bit, but if the little bit of sustain helped you actually survive and/or win a team fight? Hard to tell... so still not very satisfying.

What does feel painfully obvious is the damage and kill potential you sacrifice by not going 21 points into the offensive tree (not to mention **DANGEROUS GAME** -- the one point mastery that can decide a winning or losing lane).

I pretty much abandoned the concept and went back to 21 offensive like everyone else.

vlad has more sustain with CDR quints. probably even with AP quints. his q  heal scales with AP directly, and CDR lets you cast it more often.

if you combine that with the mastery vampirism... its noticable imo

The talent is near useless, as the health potion and total biscuit give more sustain then 1 or even 2 points in Vampirism ever would.

I feel the Health Regen in Defense Tree should be switched with this, and Vampirism should be in the same tier as 1.5% health, since most offense trees put at least 7 points into defense anyway and find that last point fairly useless.

Honestly, when I put the points elsewhere, I don't notice the lack of vamp or spellvamp.  When I take points out of health in defense or the buff duration in utility to get Vampirism, I DO notice the loss of those.

I honestly have only used Vampirism on Talon, mainly due to my mastery tree for AD assassins being 21/0/9 for AD assassins because I focus try to focus on building damage and movement speed in order to gank other lanes

I've found in the past when the jungle was harder, the mastery made more sense.  Now, pots get you through the first clear and the jungle items beef you up after that.  Personally, I kinda like where the jungle is right too, so I don't necessarily want to see the mastery buffed.  Maybe it could be replaced with something else?

I think the main issue is just that Havoc is such a good mastery that it's silly not to go 21 into offense on anyone who's a primary damage dealer, and it's damage dealers who get the most out of lifesteal/spell vamp.

I've tried it a lot of places, and it's never been satisfying anywhere but in the jungle. If you go 9/9/12, you get most of the early offensive and defensive stats you might be used to, and you'll also get Runic Affinity and Alchemist as a bonus. It's mostly useful on heavy farm junglers who want to chill in the jungle for a long time in between recalls. Even then it's not amazing, just viable.

I don't feel like allowing people to get the spellvamp/lifesteal AND offensive masteries at the same time is a good idea, though. Most likely the sustain would either be strong enough to be relevant, in which case you'd HAVE to take it, or it wouldn't be that powerful and would remain uncommon. There are a lot of sustain masteries out there already, though, so I'm not sure that just making it into another sustain mastery would be ideal, either. 

At the moment, supports tend to take 17 points into utility without very much variation in what they take high in the tree. The first 8 points in the tree are pretty variable, but in tiers 3, 4, and 5, they'll grab Greed, Culinary Master, Scavenger, Wealth, and Bandit every time. That will leave you with 2 points to allocate somewhere. Ideally, I think it would be nice if supports had a choice Inspiration, Meditation, and Vampirism. If those three were changed to be balanced with each other- and I'm not sure how you'd do that- and each had a cap of 2 points, you'd essentially have to choose between them. Meditation would help you poke more if mana gated you, Vampirism would help you trade more, and Inspiration would help you keep up in levels if you roam more.

Both Vampirism and Inspiration feel pretty weak- but more so Inspiration. As it stands, it would take 5 minutes of standing next to a higher level champion to get from level 1 to level 2. That doesn't sound that bad, but it would take over 30 minutes to level from level 17 to 18 from this mastery. It just doesn't do very much. Even for 2 points, that's not worth it. Not sure how much it would have to be buffed to be valuable, but I'd definitely want it more powerful.
Buffed Inspiration would be pretty good with new Mordekaiser and his bonus exp thingy.

I did the math below:

On the potion/biscuit sustain versus 3% steal/vamp. Each potion returns +35hp. Most midlaners start 2 potions for a total +70 hp in lane. You would have to deal 2333 damage (after resistances) to match the sustain. 

Assuming starting hp of 600, you would have to deal 1800 damage to regen the 54 max hp you can start with from the tier 2 and 3 max hp defense talents.

In other words, 3% spellvamp can be useful, but it's not useful enough **relative to other accessible talents** and especially not at the cost of 3% total damage and 2% flat pen (19/0/11).

If i go for Vampirism, it's usually because i opt for 9/0/21 on a mage midlane.
However, i mostly do that because with cdr/lvl glyphs, cdr-boots and 10% from masteries, i'm at the 40%cdr cap, so i can go tear and pick up the insane ~160+ ap from Seraphs, while gaining enough mana-sustain to back up the pool from meditation while wandere suports my roam heavy playstyle mid.
The Vampirism is like the biscuits or 40 extra gold(1 potion), it's need to have and helps in lane, but by no means the reason to go depp into the support tree.
Can't say i really noticed it, besides on Ryze, cassio or Mlaz, but thats mostly because i run spellvamp runes as well on those, doubling the spellvamp i got compared to only masteries.
Spellvamp overall still has the problem off beeing bad on multitarget spells unless you have you clear out waves, and a maÃ¶zahar E or Cassio E which also kind clear waves while beeing singletarget give 200% more health back upon clearing...

I feel like vampirism would be better suited for the deeper de fense tree, so you stll can't go full-off + vampirism, but have acces to it on the champos you really would like it(which for me would be the likes of renekton, shyvana or darius, just that you really need aditional combatstats)
Besides midlane mages, supports and some junglers, going utillity simply doesn't work.
Toplane is usually a to close matchup with to much fighting for utillity, as you need aditional combat stats as early as possible.
High pressure junglers like Lee also want aditional combat stats rather early, so their ganks are more powerfull while they clear faster.
Assasins want higher damage so they can actually blow up things and adc obviuslly want to deal as much damage as possible.
Also, on most farm depended champions, you want atleast 9 points in offense, so you have the bonus damage vs minions and the flat ad to improve your lasthits, so even if vampirism was a one-point wonder, i'm not sure if i would go for it as tank/fighter, especially cause the other 8 points in utillity are rather lackluster.
Additionally, going deep into the support tree doesn't offer much if you don't want mana, and the huge number of gold generating masteries is kinda boring and the exp thing is only helpfull if you drop in exp, which you wouldn't asume as sololaner.

The only setup I regularly use (that doesn't go 21 deep in anything) is my 15/0/15 page just for Syndra. 15 in offense is just enough to get the +%ap mastery, and the 15 in utility for %missing mana regen. Although, I only take 2 points in vampirism since I like the health biscuit mastery. :3

If it were a one-point wonder it would make an interesting choice for players.

Extra bulk from Defense or better sustain from Utility.

It really should be added to the defense tree as two separate talents in tier 2 and 3 as an alternative choice to HP and %hp.  3 points in tier 2 for 3% vamp and 1 point in tier 3 for an additional 2% vamp.

The problem is that % vamp is just not as good at sustain as the potion/biscuit utility talents in early game.

**EDIT:** I just did the math on the potion/biscuit sustain versus 3% steal/vamp. Each potion returns +35hp. Most midlaners start 2 potions for a total +70 hp in lane. You would have to deal **2333** damage (after resistances) to match the sustain. 

However, the steal/vamp is actually more effective in short windows when you're in duels or skirmishes. You only have to do 100 dps to match the healing per second from a ticking biscuit, and a duel to the death will require far more dps than that even at early levels.

In other words, 3% is better when it counts and scales far better into mid and late game. It's more for in-fight sustain than early laning.
As a support, utility should have at least some good stuff that worth putting points into. Even though I don't do huge damage as a support and spellvamp/lifesteal is not as effective.....

Biscuits apply their bonus heal instant, only the normal potion goes over time.
so in a fight you need to deal over ~1167 damage after mitigation to out heal the biscuite.
And if you go ham on 5 bicuites, you can heal 175 hp...
